intro: Rondeletia liebmanii, commonly known as the red-eyed stinging nettle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking red bracts that resemble eyes, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite and often have a velvety texture, while the stems are covered in fine, stinging hairs. Rondeletia liebmanii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas.
